title: How do musicians make music? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe each musician’s particular process is unique to them, though I'm sure there are similarities. Emotion, for example, is always essential when making music. Personally, I just have fun on whatever instrument I'm using until something jumps out at me. I'll be screwing around and suddenly think “wow that really resonates deeply”, that is, it creates a powerful feeling (could be uplifting, sombre etc). Then I'll hang on to that particular feeling and develop the section further until I'm satisfied. Sometimes it ends up being a little loop, other times a whole piece. Often other sections I’ve composed in the past are incorporated (though I’ve come to think of this as lazy). Basically you explore yourself through the composition.
